choices: A raccoon named Glenn, the CEO of the company.
A vixen named Ruby, the head of research and development.
A dragon named Ike, an intern in the R&D department.
A dovess named Ava, a reporter touring the facility.

1.content:
Had anyone at a different organization suggested it, the Size Modulator had been passed off as science fiction, an idiotic and completely impossible idea. But Genex wasn't like most other companies. Fueled by a combination of brilliant scientific minds and cold, calculating business sense, not to mention some very deep pockets on the part of its investors, the biotech company had made quite a name for itself in a matter of years since its inception.

So when the initial blueprints for the size-altering device were tossed around the drawing board, the question was not 'if', but 'how'. The Size Modulator was conceived originally as a way to make long-distance shipping of large objects much easier by reducing the objects in size for travel and then restoring them to normal when they arrived at their destinations.

But, as with many things, there can a large gap between intent and actuality. With the development of the first prototype of the device, moods were running high. The energy was palpable. And someone had managed to get past the hefty security surrounding the device and get their hands on it. That person was...



[NOTE: A brief aside about the "logistics" of the Size Modulator. As the device uses a beam, anything the individual affected is carrying or wearing changes size along with them. But that doesn't mean they can't take it off later ;) By similar logic, the device itself will change size as well, so long as the person is holding it themselves. This doesn't happen, of course, if it's dropped, used by someone else on them, etc. etc. The more you know!]
1.title: Genex Biotechnologies

choices: ... meet his friend, a stallion named Ethan, whom he'd told about the device.
... take the device for a little test spin.
... find his cheating ex.
(free choice)
(free choice)
11.content:
Grimacing, Glenn glanced at his wristwatch for perhaps the hundredth time in the past minute or so. The meeting was already five minutes overlong, and they had still three items to cover. He was now starting to figure out why they were called ‘board’ meetings. You’d think having the most influential position in the firm would exempt him from having to sit through these drudgeries. At least that was what Glenn had believed before he’d taken the position. He very quickly learned that the exact opposite was true. Youthful naïveté.

Not that Glenn had exactly passed his youth. He could still count the years since his graduation at the top of his class on one hand. The handsome raccoon had enjoyed a rapid climb up the corporate ladder, winning the (sometimes begrudging) respect of his peers and making a pretty penny in the process. Several billion pretty pennies. He’d earned a reputation for always getting what he wanted, even if that meant twisting a few arms.

So when he’d joined on at the top of the hierarchy of Genex Biotechnologies, some of his friends and colleagues had baffled at his decision. With his connections and business intellect, Glenn could have easily landed a position with any Fortune 500 company without breaking a sweat; why choose a dinky little biotech firm that had barely elevated itself above the status of ‘startup’?

Every once in a while, looking out the windows of his plush office on the topmost floor of a midtown skyscraper, Glenn allowed himself a chuckle at all the doubt. Sure, it had taken a good deal of effort and more than a couple proverbial throat-slashings to get there, but the raccoon had guided the firm with a steady hand in the direction of success.

No, despite its somewhat upstart nature, Glenn noted that there were some definite perks to his involvement with the biotech firm. Genex always had a lot of plates spinning and, though he wasn’t particularly interested in actually talking with any of the flunkies down in the Research and Development section, the raccoon every now and then encountered something that genuinely piqued his interest.

The Size Modulator was probably topmost amongst these interests. The lab coat giving the tour and talk had droned on about revolutionizing transportation of large goods or something, but once he'd seen the sleek, silvery gun enlarge a pack of cards to the proportions of a king-size bed, a whole slough of different ideas popped into his mind.

Glenn considered himself a go-getter type, so he set about securing the device for himself. It had taken some time, but the results were presently practically burning a hole in the inside pocket of his blazer. The raccoon had smuggled the device out of the high-security storage room earlier that afternoon, and the gun was practically begging for use. We can push the beta tests forward a few weeks, Glenn thought to himself, a smirk flitting across his lips.

"Alright guys, sounds good," Glenn pushed back from the conference table, clapping his hands twice impatiently. "Let's pick this up Tuesday afternoon. We've got a long weekend to enjoy, don't we?"

The raccoon was the first through the doors, off to...
11.title: Board Meeting Blues

choices: ... enthusiastically agrees.
... is impatient and wants to try out the device then and there.
... wants to try to steal the device for himself.
111.content:
Drumming his fingers impatiently on the steering wheel of his sleek sports car, Glenn glanced at the rearview mirror again to see if Ethan was coming yet. Apparently, he wasn’t the only person whose meetings ran indecently late on Fridays. And leading up to a long holiday weekend, too. Not okay. At the least, it made him feel a little less bad for showing up to the rendezvous point a little bit late.

A little shiver of anticipation ran up the raccoon's spine as he waited, unable to deny his sense of gleeful thrill. Waiting in the semi-dark parking garage, it felt as if he were in some sort of cloak-and-dagger secret mission. In a way, he supposed, it was. Well, things wouldn't be secret for long, he snorted.

Glenn heard the clicking of hooves against concrete as Ethan sauntered up, pulling open the car door. The handsome brown-haired stallion slid into the passenger seat, adjusting it backwards as far as it would go in order to accommodate his nearly-seven-foot frame. He still had to bend his knees a little, his shins brushing lightly against the glove compartment.

“Watch your hooves,” Glenn cautioned, adjusting his rearview mirror.

“Good afternoon to you, too,” Ethan snorted. "So... is it here?"

"Check it out," Glenn replied with as much nonchalance as he could muster, jerking his head in the direction of the glove compartment.

The stallion parted his legs a little as he leaned forward, pulling open the glove compartment and slipping in his hand. He rummaged around a little before pulling out the Size Modulator.

"Shit," he muttered, hefting the silvery gun-like device in his palm. "You weren't bullshitting me. It does work, right?"

"Of course it does," the raccoon sniffed dismissively. "Would I be sitting in this damned parking garage if it didn't?"

"I suppose not," Ethan shrugged, still staring at the device. "Well then, what's the plan, boz?"

Glenn grinned wickedly. "Ever wanted to take over a country?"

Ethan's eyes went wide and he ran his fingers through his jet black mane. "Er... I can safely say the thought's never crossed my mind,"

"That's because you have no ambition," Glenn tsked.

"I mean... don't you think that's starting a little bit, er, large scale? Forgive the pun,"

"Oh, we won't be doing anything domestic," Glenn shook his head. "No. You ever been to San Lorenzo?"

Ethan shook his head. "Can't say as I have,"

"Great place. Little island nation. Slice of paradise. And with the help of that, our little slice of paradise. I don't know about you, I've had a bitch of a week and that sounds like one hell of a way to blow off steam. I've already got my charter jet all set for the trip. Let's get out of here,"

Ethan...
111.title: Sharing is Caring

choices: ... the plane had landed in San Lorenzo.
... the plane is in a bout of turbulence.
... the plane has crashed in the middle of nowhere.
1111.content:
"Are you kidding me?" the stallion grinned. "Let's get this show on the road,"

"I was hoping you'd say that," Glenn grinned, shifting the car into gear.

The airport was only a few miles from the commerce district, so even with the pre-weekend traffic Glenn was able to get there in a fairly short amount of time. He pulled into the private lot around the back and the pair passed through a pair of security gates and onto the landing strip.

Glenn's baby, a black twin-engine, was already waiting for them on the tarmac. The raccoon paused for a moment to admire the aircraft, his arms folded across his chest and a smile on his lips. Ethan rolled his eyes.

“You and your jet,” he snorted.

“Hey, I’m allowed to have my toys,” Glenn chuckled.

“We'll be playing with whole cities soon enough, if your little laser gun works the way you said it does” Ethan shrugged, pushing forward and clambering up the stairs that folded out from the doorway of the plane.

Ethan was already settled into one of the plush armchairs in the lounge area of the cabin when Glenn eased into the seat opposite.

“Gave the pilot the plans. We're taking off in a few minutes. It'll be a little while. Plenty of time to catch a few winks and maybe a nod. Gotta be fresh for my big debut,” the raccoon said, cracking his knuckles. “What’s that you’ve got there?” Glenn asked, jerking his head at the glass resting on the stallion’s armrest.

“Manhattan. Double,” Ethan replied, taking a sip. “Want one?”

“I’ll pass, thanks,” Glenn shook his head. It just seemed like the whole thing would be a bit less fun when you were numb from the alcohol. Besides, why run the risk of getting the world’s largest case of whiskey dick when you least wanted it?

“Suit yourself,” Ethan shrugged, taking another swig.

“Gonna be a long flight,” Glenn repeated, reclining further.

“Plenty of time to get my buzz on, then,"

Glenn shook his head a little, closing his eyes. He prided himself on his ability to sleep like a rock on plane flights, and this was no exception. The raccoon was snoozing soundly in no time. When he jerked awake...
1111.title: Off to Paradise

choices: ... one of us needs to get huge to carry the plane and everything back to land,"
... we ought to see if we can find a radio onboard to call for help,"
11113.content:
A series of jarring shakes, each more violent than the one before, ripped Glenn unceremoniously from his nap. His eyes snapped open. The cabin was hazy, the air thick with smoke. Fumbling to his feet, the raccoon felt his way blindly down the aisle, coughing and hacking on the smoke. Several panic-filled moments later, Glenn found the door, stumbling out into the fresh air of the outside.

Scrambling down the stairs, Glenn collapsed on the sandy ground. He was sitting on the sloping beach of what appeared to be a small island. Well, perhaps calling it an 'island' would be a little bit too kind. 'Mound of sand in the middle of the goddamn ocean' was probably a better title. About the only things the place had in the way of vegetation were a few sad-looking palm trees that appeared to have been there purely by accident. The sun beat down mercilessly on the whole scene.

Ethan stood a few dozen feet away, pacing back and forth periodically, his hand resting on his muzzle. Behind Glenn was the smoking wreck of the plane. An entire wing of the craft had been torn off and the tail section had taken some heavy damage.

"What in the hell happened here?" Glenn gasped, scrambling to his feet and walking towards Ethan. "How... how is that even possible?"

"I don't know," the stallion replied numbly, his eyes wide. "We'd been up for a few hours and the captain said to prepare for some turbulence. Well, it hit, but then... things got a hell of a lot worse,"

"Is the captain alright?" Glenn asked nervously.

Ethan shook his head slowly. "I tried to pull him out of the cockpit, but there was so much fire,"

"Damn," Glenn said, at a loss for words for once in his life. A frown furrowed his brow. "Wait. You didn't think to try and pull me out? Wow, bro. Not cool,"

"Hey, I was in a panic!" Ethan retorted, throwing his hands into the air. "You're fine. Don't freak out,"

"I can't think of anything to do but freak out," the raccoon said.

"We should stay calm. It won't help anything if we freak out," Ethan said.

"How are we going to get out of here? They're going to start looking for us when we don't show at the airport, right?"

"The authorities think we're going somewhere totally different, remember? That decoy flight plan you gave won't lead them anywhere near here,"

"Where is 'here', anyway?" Glenn asked.

Ethan shrugged. "Haven't the foggiest," he replied. "Maybe the GPS on the plane is still okay. That ought to give us a clue. But we need to think of a plan of action to get the hell of this damn island,"

Glenn frowned in concentration, stroking his chin. "Well, far as I see it...
11113.title: Desert Island

choices: ... heads up (Ethan).
... tails up (Glenn).
111131.content:
Ethan's brow arched. "That Size Modulator really is burning a hole in your pocket, isn't it? But why only the one of us?" he asked. "Why don't we both get super-sized and swim for it? Fuck the stupid plane. It's just excess baggage,"

"I thought about that initially," Glenn shrugged. "But we don't know where we are, much less which way to go. For all we know, we could be swimming for hours in the wrong direction. No, we need one of us to stay, er, 'normal'. Once the plane is safe, we need to use that GPS unit to get back to somewhere more... mainland-ish. Need a guide so we know where we're going, I figure,"

Ethan threw his hands up in the air. "I suppose you're right. Now. I'm a good swimmer, I figure I could take care of that part. You can be the intrepid navigator,"

"Hey, not so fast!" Glenn replied. "I'm a pretty damn good swimmer, too,"

"So we find ourselves at a crossroads," the stallion snorted. "What do we do, rock-paper-scissors?"

The raccoon fished in his pocket, pulling out a coin. "Call it," he said.

"Heads," Ethan said.

"Alright," Glenn replied. He placed the coin on the flat of his thumb, flipping it. The coin landed...

choices: ... Size Roulette,"
... Glennzilla vs. Ethanra,"

1112.content:
Ethan couldn't help but shake his head as Glenn outlined his plans. "Why wait?" he pressed. "C'mon, Glenn. You've always been the go-getter type. So why not take it for a spin right now? The world is our oyster,"

Glenn pursed his lips. "I don't think that's a smart idea," he shook his head. "I mean, this is our home turf. I don't really fancy getting thrown in jail or anything,"

"Are you kidding me?" Ethan snorted. "We'll be unstoppable! Or are you too pussy? I guess the only risks you take are when it's just the pocketbook of one of your investors on the line,"

Ethan knew he'd struck a chord as Glenn roughly shifted the car into gear and screeched out of the parking garage. Fifteen minutes of furious driving later, the pair stood in an old vacated warehouse in the middle of the industrial district.

"Alright, if you don't want to wait, let's get this show on the road," Glenn said, setting the device down on top of a crate.

Ethan blinked in confusion as Glenn walked a short distance away and began methodically removing his clothes, folding them in a pile.

"Er, what are you doing?" Ethan asked.

"You can't honestly expect me to go on a rampage in my best suit, can you?" Glenn shook his head, pulling off his boxers. "No, this 'coon is stomping it out in his birthday suit. Come on. You've been going on and on about that stupid Bowflex regimen you've been on. This is the perfect chance to strut your stuff,"

Ethan hesitated before shaking his head ruefully as he shrugged off his suit jacket. "Never thought I'd be getting naked with you," he snorted.

"Bet you never thought you'd be growing to giant size with me, either," Glenn grinned.

The raccoon swaggered past Ethan, picking the Size Modulator up off the crate. He twirled it around his finger, grinning at the stallion.

"Lemme tell you what. Let's mix this up a bit," Glenn said, stroking his chin. "Let's make a bit of a game of it,"

"What are you talking about?" Ethan arched his brow.

The raccoon grinned. "I was thinking we should play a game of...
1112.title: Patience Isn't Always a Virtue

choices: ... a slight buzz, like static electricity.
... a powerful jolt that nearly knocked the wind out of him.
11121.content:
"Come again?" Ethan blinked.

"You a gambling horse?" Glenn grinned cheekily, resting a hand on his hip as he spun the device around his finger.

Chuckling, the raccoon padded over so he was standing next to his friend, holding up the Size Modulator. "See these things here?" he said, pointing to a series of dials around the barrel of the device. Most of the dials had the numbers 0-9 stamped around their circumference, with a final flip-switch that alternated between a division and a multiplication sign. "Give 'em a spin and then blast the device. Round and round they go, where they stop, nobody knows. You could end up a mile-high colossus or an inch-tall insect. Or, you know, something in between,"

Ethan gritted his teeth in a half-grin, rocking his head back and forth in hesitation and folding his arms across his broad chest. "I dunno, man. Seems a bit... risky, ya know?" he said. "Why don't we play it safe this first time around? You know, supersize ourselves a bit, stomp around awhile, call it a day. Fun had by all,"

"C'mon Ethan! First rule of business is to take risks!" Glenn chided. "You were so gung-ho about this half an hour ago you wanted to skip a plane ride to get started, and now you're all 'safety first'? C'mon. Live large a little,"

The stallion shook his head agains, smiling a little. "Oh, what the hell. You always were the silver-tongued one. Sure. Let's do this,"

"There you go," Glenn grinned, smacking Ethan on the ass as he strode buoyantly away. "Let's go out here. Don't want to go blowing the roof off this place just yet,"

Ethan followed Glenn outside of the warehouse and out to a large stretch of open pavement. Standing in the middle of de facto courtyard between the various warehouses, Glenn spun around so that he was facing Ethan, a few feet away.

"Ladies first," the raccoon grinned.

"Huh? Wait--" Ethan said.

But before the stallion had a chance to get a word in edgewise, the raccoon gave the dials a generous spin and blasted him squarely in the chest. Ethan felt...
11121.title: Spinning the Wheel

choices: ... 50 feet.
1113.content:
Ethan's mind was racing a million miles an hour. Unable to tear his eyes from the device, he couldn't help but think of all of the things he could do with it. Glenn was great and all, but he just got in the way. No, the stallion wanted this power all to himself. And he was accustomed to getting his way.

Yawning widely, the stallion stretched as best as the confines of Glenn's car would allow. "You know," he said, "that sounds great. Super fun. But I've had a crazy day and I'm wiped out. Rain check? I'll be much more fun once I've had a little bit of shut-eye,"

"You can sleep on the plane!" Glenn protested. "C'mon, man,"

"I've never understood how people can sleep on flights," Ethan shook his head, palming the device into his trousers pocket. "Tell you what. Do me a huge favor. Lemme grab a solid night's sleep at home, then show up tomorrow and we'll head out, okay? We can get our Godzilla on or shrink down the thing and put it in a bottle, or whatever the hell you have planned. But I can promise you I won't be any fun running on absolutely no sleep. I, for one, don't want to be a buzzkill. Come on, bro, just do me a solid here,"

Ethan grinned winningly at his old pal, pantomiming slipping the device back into the glove compartment and shutting it with a click. The raccoon groaned loudly but nodded.

"Alright, fine," he growled, turning the keys in the ignition. "Be lame like that. But you better not whine when I show up at your place at oh dark thirty tomorrow!"

"Of course not," Ethan chuckled. "Wouldn't miss this chance for the world,"

------

Ethan sat on the edge of the motel room bed, staring at the device as he shifted it between his hands. He couldn't believe Glenn had fallen for it hook, line, and sinker. Nobody could pull a fast one on the raccoon in the boardroom, but apparently all it took to trick him outside work was a little sleight of hand, and fairly poor sleight of hand at that.

Almost as soon as Glenn had dropped Ethan off at his apartment did the stallion head out on his own to a small, dingy motel on the outskirts of town. He figured it would only be a matter of time before Glenn realized his device was missing, and he didn't want to be home when the undoubtedly furious raccoon showed up there.

Fiddling with the device, Ethan wiped the perspiration from his brow. It had been a hot day, and the motel room was poorly ventilated. He'd stripped down to his boxer-briefs and wife-beater, but that hadn't done all that much to mitigate the heat.

The device slipped in Ethan's sweaty hand and his finger hit the trigger. He jumped a little as a pale white particle beam shot out, hitting the bedside table. A fraction of a second later, the piece of furniture was no larger than a matchbox. The Size Modulator slipped through Ethan's finger's as he crossed towards the minuscule bedside table. Stooping down, the stallion picked the table up, turning it this way and that.

"Holy shit, Glenn was right," Ethan said as the tiny alarm clock slipped off the table, plummeting towards the ground. "It really does work!"

Ethan looked back at the device on the floor, his pulse quickening. Dusting off his hands on his boxer-briefs, the stallion, snatched the Size Modulator off the ground and left the room through the sliding glass door at its rear. He walked a short distance away from the motel as he fiddled with the dials on the side of the device that he figured were in control of size modulation.

His heart racing, Ethan pointed the ray at himself and pulled the trigger. He seized up as the beam hit him in the chest. The device slipped through his fingers as Ethan began to grow to the towering height of...
1113.title: Greedy Stallion

choices: ... the hustle and bustle of downtown.
... Glenn's neighborhood.
11133.content:
When Ethan's vision cleared again, he was the biggest living thing in existence. By a long shot. The stallion's immense frame stretched up and up into the night sky, dominating its surroundings. Out there in the outskirts of town, even the tallest structures scarcely reached the lower portions of his calves.

Ethan looked down the length of his body towards the ground far below. Massive hooves bit into the ground, ploughing aside concrete like soil. His boxer-briefs and wife-beater still clung to his sweaty body, now providing enough material to outfit an entire army. A cool breeze whirled gently around Ethan, ruffling his mane.

A grin spread slowly across the stallion's monumental lips. His chuckle rumbled like thunder across the neighborhood.

"Well, I'll be damned," Ethan murmured to himself. "That thing really did work,"

Experimentally, Ethan lifted one leg high into the air, bringing it down heavily on the old warehouse on the other side of the parking lot from the motel. The structure crumbled under his lightest touch, the impact sending out shockwaves and cracking pavement. Ethan smirked as he heard a few car alarms get tripped.

"I think I enjoy this immensely," the towering stallion boomed, resting his hands on his hips and tossing his mane.

Scanning his newly miniature surroundings, Ethan considered his options. The glittering lights of downtown in the distance beckoned temptingly to him, but the whole world was his oyster now. He could do anything he wished.

Slowly, relishing every thunderous step, Ethan began to walk away from the motel parking lot. The walking, talking skyscraper was heading towards...
11133.title: Equine Titan

choices: "I came to get you, come outside so i can grow you too!"
"Gotta get rid of the evidence, so noone knows how to stop me..."
111332.content:
Each of the massive equine behemoth's footsteps smashed into the ground with the force of a small explosion. Concrete and asphault was smashed and ripped apart as if nothing more than brittle dried mud beneath his unfathomable weight. Power lines, lamp posts and stop lights were uprooted and ripped apart against the titan's immense ankles and calfs as he walked. Already the suburbs had gone into a confused panic as what sounded like repetitious explosions and quakes going off nearby woke them from their slumber. It was still barely light outside, that mixed with the sudden awakening left many of them confused and unable to properly focus or comprehend the monstrous beast that was heading in their direction.

All of them but one it seemed.

Glenn stared out of his living room window with wide eyes and his tail curled reflexively around him in worry, as if the flimsy fuzzy appendage would somehow protect him from his blunder. He knew damn well who this monstrous beast was, even despite him being so big that only part of him could be seen at once. Glenn wasn't stupid, it didn't take much to connect the dots. When he heard a thunderous explosion of sound echo from the beast towering over the neighborhood, it only proved his theory.

"GLENN" the giant boomed, voice blasting across the landscape and violently rattling windows in their settings from the sheer bass of it. "I DECIDED TO TAKE SOME INITIATIVE AND GET STARTED EARLY..." His voice thundered.

Though he was standing so near Glenn's home, the raccoon couldn't see straight up enough to see the titanic horse's face, the tone in his voice easily betrayed the wide, smug grin across Ethan's muzzle. The raccoon was terrified, he had no idea what the horse was planning. maybe it was all just some kind of joke and Ethan was trying to scare him before letting Glenn join him up there... or maybe his darker fears were true... and Ethan had just taken advantage of him to get power. Fortunately (or unfortunately) Glenn didn't have to wait long to have his questions answered as the gigantic horse rumbled out his intent...
111332.title: Getting rid of the evidence?!

choices: ... the device, miraculously intact.
... the crushed remains of the device.
1113321.content:
Breathing a deep sigh of relief, Glenn hustled through his front door and into the night. Ignoring the chaos of the neighborhood around him, the raccoon craned his neck as far up as he could, even leaning backwards slightly in order to get as good a view of Ethan as he could manage. The stallion was unimaginably enormous. Thick, powerfully muscled legs stretched up into the sky, hooves planted on either end of Glenn's block. Far above, Glenn could glimpse the underside of the stallion's muzzle. Sure enough, he was smirking. Glenn chuckled; of course that was Ethan's natural response to the whole situation.

"Alright, I'm outside!" Glenn bellowed as loud as he possibly could, cupping his hands around his mouth to provide extra amplification.

For a moment, the raccoon doubted that Ethan had heard a word he had said. But then the equine titan shifted, crouching down low and resting on his haunches. Ethan's face swam into better view as he leaned down further. Glenn waved his arms emphatically. He had never felt smaller. Ethan's searching gaze landed on Glenn and a grin crossed his lips.

"THERE YOU ARE," he boomed.

"What do you want me to do?" Glenn shouted back.

"NO NEED TO LOSE YOUR VOICE, DUDE," Ethan snorted, tapping the side of his head. "HAVING AN EXCELLENT SENSE OF HEARING COMES IN HANDY WHEN YOU'RE AS BIG AS ME,"

"Good to know," Glenn replied, lowering his voice a little. "Though you can probably whisper and I'll be alright, too. Two-way street and all,"

"ALRIGHT, HERE'S THE DEAL. I SORTA... DROPPED THE DEVICE WHEN I USED IT,"

"You what!?"

"I JUST NEED TO TAKE YOU BACK TO WHERE IT IS SO WE CAN USE IT ON YOU. AND MAYBE THEN YOU SHOULD DO A BETTER JOB OF HANGING ONTO IT THAN I DID," Ethan rumbled, ignoring the comparatively tiny raccoon's interjection. "GET INTO THAT CAR AT THE END OF YOUR DRIVEWAY. IT'LL BE EASIER TO PICK UP THAN YOU,"

Tearing his eyes away from Ethan's massive mug, Glenn glanced at the sedan parked next to his driveway. He couldn't help but smirk as he hurried towards it. His neighbor had always parked way too close to his home for his liking; now Glenn got the last laugh. He smashed the glass of the driver's side window, ignoring the car alarm as he opened the door and slid in.

"ALRIGHT, UP WE GO,"

Glenn flinched as Ethan's thumb and forefinger gripped the sides of the sedan, lifting it upwards. His stomach plummeted as the car was lifted into the air as Ethan got to his hooves.

The trip back was easy enough, as Ethan just had to follow his smouldering hoofprints to the origin of his growth. Setting the car down again, he said "ALRIGHT, IT SHOULD BE SOMEWHERE AROUND HERE,"

Eagerly anticipating his own growth, Glenn exited the car and began combing through the rubble of the alleyway for the device. After a few minutes' search, he found...
1113321.title: Partner Venture

choices: ... was crushed under the rubble.
... had managed to live through the ordeal mostly unscathed.
1113322.content:
Glenn's heart plummeted into his stomach as he heard (or more felt, really) Ethan's declaration. Shit shit shit, was all he could manage to think. His fate was sealed.

"SORRY GLENN, IT'S NOTHING PERSONAL," Glenn numbly registered the colossal equine rumble. "BUSINESS IS BUSINESS, AND YOU KNOW HOW THAT WORKS. LET'S JUST SAY YOU DIDN'T EXACTLY GET YOUR RETURN ON INVESTMENT FOR THIS VENTURE,"

But the raccoon was already off and running, scrambling towards the back door to his home in a desperate bid for escape. If Ethan kept monologuing in the way he was, maybe he stood a chance. Vaulting over the living room couch, Glenn shot towards the door, practically kicking it open in his haste.

Running out into the warm night air, Glenn crossed his yard as quickly as he possibly could, scrambling over the fence and hitting the pavement hard. His heart rushing, the raccoon kept running, following the road on the other side of his backyard away from the horse who towered over his house and the rest of the neighborhood. As Ethan began to speak again, Glenn had to resist the urge to look back. Every millisecond was precious.

"WELL, SORRY GLENN, BUT I GOTTA DO WHAT I GOTTA DO," Ethan boomed. "ONTO BIGGER AND BETTER THINGS. MOSTLY BIGGER,"

The enormous wall of Ethan's hoof came down, obliterating Glenn's home effortlessly. Losing his footing, Glenn threw himself to the side, taking whatever cover he could behind a blue metal mail drop-off box as a shockwave of rubble and earth rushed outwards toward him.

*****

Grinning down from a thousand feet above the earth, Ethan raised his hoof to admire his handiwork. Bet you didn't think you'd soon be able to level a house without breaking a sweat when you woke up this morning, the titanic stallion thought with a smirk. He lifted his eyes upward. The world was his oyster, and he was going to crack it.

Meanwhile, Glenn...
1113322.title: Clearing the Way

choices: ... trying it on someone else first.
... sizing himself up a little.
... going for broke and making himself enormous.
112.content:
Moments later, Glenn stood in the deserted alley behind his office building, holding the device in his hands and staring down at it. He couldn't help but grin like a kid in a candy shape: he held in his hands virtually unlimited power, to use however he chose. But how to use it? The raccoon had only witnessed the device in action once or twice, and then he'd been across a room behind a thick plexiglass shield. He turned the Size Modulator over and over, trying to figure out how Ruby had used it in the trial runs.

A series of numbered dials were set into the side of the barrel with a knob that alternated between multiplication and division symbols. Seems about right, I guess, the coon shrugged, fiddling with the dials.

Ultimately, Glenn decided to test the device out by...
112.title: Time to Get This Show On the Road

choices: ... pays a visit to a rival company.
... shows off to his coworkers.
... has some fun downtown.
1122.content:
The blast from the Size Modulator was at once invigorating, powerful, and a little painful. A groan escaped the raccoon's lips as he felt the jolt surging through his body, staggering him back a step. The effects were almost instantaneous. A strange warmth filled Glenn's chest, spreading quickly outward to the tips of his fingers and toes. The raccoon laughed deeply as he watched the world reducing in size around him as he swelled larger and larger.

Moments later, a five story tall Glenn stood in the alleyway, his shoulders brushing against the buildings on either side. Brushing a bit of dust off his lapel, the raccoon grinned broadly. He was ready to take on the world! Well, almost. Can't exactly go stomping around downtown in my business getup, can I? Glenn smirked.

Off came the suit jacket and collared shirt. Kicking off his shoes and socks, Glenn leaned over to deal with his trousers. Taking the grey material in his hands, he tore the legs off at the knee, creating tattered knee-length breeches. Satisfied with his impromptu makeover, Glenn squeezed out of the alleyway, charging onto the street.

Glenn...
1122.title: Attack of the 50-Foot Executive

choices: ... take Systemic out of the picture altogether,"
... do a little bit of leadership rearrangement for you guys,"
11221.content:
At first, the temptation to smash up a building or two was pretty strong. But rampaging could wait just a little; Glenn had things to take care of first. One thing, especially.

A smirk on his lips, the giant raccoon strode off down the street, his destination already in mind. Dozens fled before his thudding bare feet, the crowd gathering in response to the commotion and now terrified to discover its source. The chaos below barely registered to Glenn five stories above, the coon too focused on his goal to care all that much. The cracking pavement massaged his feet.

The offices of Systemic Systems, Inc. was a dozen or so blocks away from Genex, only a few minutes' walk for Glenn. The building was an unassuming concrete structure that only reached the middle of Glenn's chest. He leaned over, resting a hand on the rooftop as he peered through the windows of the uppermost floor. A broad grin crossed his face as he saw that a board meeting was going on.

"Hello there," the raccoon cleared his throat as he tapped on the window with one fingertip, shattering the glass.

A coyote who was standing at the lead of the boardroom table spun on his heels, dropping his coffee cup as he saw Glenn's massive mug outside.

"Holy... holy shit," the coyote gasped, staring through the broken window. "Is that you, Glenn?"

"In the fur," the raccoon replied smugly. "Should've taken you up on that bet. Because i just won it,"

"What the fuck did you do to yourself?" the coyote spluttered, shaking his head.

"It might be easier if you came up on the roof. Get the whole experience,"

"You didn't just..."

"If you were going to say 'prove once and for all that Genex is a better company than your poor excuse for a biotech corporation', then yeah, I sure did," Glenn smirked.

The coyote was unable to muster a response, so Glenn pushed onward. "And, you know what, I think the best way to further it would be to...
11221.title: Talking Shop

choices: ... try his hand at smashing up a building or two.
... visit a friend.
... put on a little strip tease.
1123.content:
When Glenn opened his eyes again, he rivalled even his office building in height. The raccoon blinked once or twice, staring in mixed disbelief and shock at his enormous reflection in the window glass of the tower.

"Holy shit," he rumbled, his voice resonating powerfully. "It really did work,"

Glenn's shocked gape gradually turned into a grin as the realization slowly sank in. He was fucking gigantic, and he was loving it.

The alleyway he stood in was a lot more of a tight fit for Glenn now that he had used the Size Modulator, his body pressing up against the structures on either side. Sidestepping, the raccoon squeezed his way out of the alley and into the relatively more spacious road beyond. Glass cracked and shattered as the buttons of Glenn's suit jacket brushed against the side of the building, tinkling to the ground dozens of feet below. The executive smirked; if he could do that without even trying, just imagine what he could do if he put in a little bit of effort.

As the enormous raccoon emerged onto the street, the reaction was almost instantaneous. Cars screeched to a stop before his massive shoes, and the muffled sounds of shouts and screams drifted up to Glenn. Music to his ears. Glenn's grin broadened. The world was his oyster.

Getting started, Glenn decided to...
1123.title: Go Huge Or Go Home

choices: ... Ruby was the biggest babe on the beach.
... the tiny Ruby was looking up at the massive restroom building.
(open choice)
(open choice)
12.content:
Ruby grinned at herself in the rearview mirror, adjusting her shoulder-length blonde hair, which was tied back in a loose ponytail. Satisfied with the results of her primping, she pushed open the car door stepped out into the parking lot of the Golden Shores Beach.

Pulling the cooler out of the hatchback of her sedan, Ruby draped her towel over her shoulder and sauntered past the rows of cars to the beach. She winked coyly at the occasional person who struggled to avert their gaze; the vixen's bikini-clad form was probably one of the leading causes of wandering eye syndrome in the city. Not that Ruby minded all that much. Gods knew she needed a break from starched lab coats and jeans now and again.

Ruby smiled and waved as she spotted her group. Crossing the warm sand towards the volleyball net, she plopped down her cooler and spread out her towel near where the other ones had been laid.

"Perfect day for the company picnic," Ruby commented to Glenn, who was standing by the grill wearing dark sunglasses and Hawaiian print trunks.

"I slipped the Sun a $100 so it would actually come out today," he chuckled.

"You know, I wouldn't doubt that for a moment," Ruby snorted.

"Want anything? Hamburger? Hot dog?" the raccoon said. Ordinarily, the CEO would never be caught dead doing anything resembling manual labor, but he was something of a self-professed grill junkie and wouldn't let anyone else near the thing.

"Oh, I'll have whatever," Ruby called over her shoulder, already heading over to see what her other coworkers were up to.

"Sure. One 'whatever' coming up," Glenn said. "Don't forget to have some fun! We're doing some morale-boosting here, you know,"

"Oh, I will," Ruby said.

Fun was certainly something Ruby intended to have. On her way out of the office that morning, the vixen had... misplaced... her section's latest major project. While the Size Modulator was supposed to be in a top-security locker, it had found a home in Ruby's fairly substantial cleavage. As the project had neared completion, Ruby had been ever increasingly intrigued by it. The company picnic seemed the perfect time for a trial run, so to speak.

After a couple of rounds of volleyball, Ruby excused herself, wandering off in the direction of the restrooms, which were located in a small brick building facing the shoreline in the shadow of several large sand dunes.

Stepping behind the restrooms, Ruby pulled out the Size Modulator. She quickly calibrated the device, glancing around furtively to make sure nobody bothered her.

Her hand shaking, she pointed the device at herself,

"Moment of truth," she muttered, pulling the trigger.

Moments later...
12.title: Beach Party

choices: Have some inappropriate fun with her friends
Get some righteous payback on her adversaries
121.content:
The party-goers on the beach paused collectively in their revelry as a bright flash emanated across the beach, rolling waves of sand down the coast. Glenn and a few of the company lab scientists shared a moment of horrified recognition, knowing the buzz and bright glimmer all too well. The businessman turned griller's analytic mind tried to consider a plan to take, an order to give, but as he watched the glowing form erupt from behind the restrooms, he drew an utter blank.

Ruby, meanwhile, opened her eyes to feel a cool breeze against her nose, her bikini still in place, but her the ground beneath her feet feeling oddly textured, less gritty and more uniformly smooth. Creaking open her eyes, the vixen saw the ocean first--ships on the horizon, tiny and blurry with distance, and then tentatively look down past her breasts to see a small red square at her feet. Squinting, she could just make out rectangular patterns of brick-laid masonry--and past that lay a beach covered in umbrellas the size of those found in drinks. Small creatures darted to and fro--furred, scaled, skinned. People. People no taller than her ankle.

"It worked!" Ruby giggled with childish glee, examining herself. Her bikini remained, good, she wanted to grow but necessary be naked just yet. The boys are gonna really be staring at my figure now, the vixen squeezed her chest experimentally a few times, running a hand down her curves experimentally, and all thanks to the--

She paused, realizing the size modulator was no longer in hand. Of course not, the lab tech wanted to slap herself, it only grows the target, not itself! For all intents and purposes, Ruby was stuck at somewhere between ten and twenty stories, the average person no bigger than her thumb. Which, the fox thought, long, fluffy tail swishing idly, is not necessarily a bad thing. Fluttering heart settling, the giantess grinned as she spotted the frantic movements of the bathers--some running, others staring--focusing her gaze on the curling smoke of Glenn's grill and the company picnic. Her friends. Her boss. Her coworkers--some of whom she liked, and many she didn't.

"Okay, then," she took a deliberate stop forward. Then another. And another. "They're gonna get a party all right." Empowered more than she'd ever felt before, the titanic vixen grinned equal parts mischief and lusty hunger as she prepared to:
121.title: ... Ruby was the biggest babe on the beach.

choices: She decides to embarrass them.
She decides to scare them a little.
She decides to take them elsewhere.
1212.content:
Ruby's smirk only grew wider as her eyes settled on the group of her coworkers clustered around the grill and volleyball net. The majority of them stood rooted to the spot, no doubt too shocked to see the enormous vixen standing before them to join in the general exodus that was occurring elsewhere on the beach. After a few moments, a few of them seemed to regain control of their legs, turning to make a beeline for the parking lot. Clucking her tongue, Ruby shook her head.

"Come on," she chided. "I thought this was supposed to be a fun day, an office retreat! I'm not about to let anything get in the way of that,"

Somehow, that only made her coworkers start to run faster. The vixen strode casually over towards the group, easily covering the distance thanks to her towering height. The grin never left her lips; oh, she had plans, alright. Ruby felt as if she put up with more shit than she needed to, and if she needed to grow to gigantic size to get even, well, so be it.

The ground shook as Ruby dropped heavily to her knees. Leaning forward, the vixen reached out, snatching up Glenn and Rita in each hand. She held the pair at chest level, grinning toothily down at them.

"But before we get back to the fun, I have a couple things to take care of," Ruby growled. "Glenn... Glenn, Glenn, Glenn. You really think you're hot shit, don't you? Well, let's make something clear. That doesn't mean you get to treat others like garbage. And you, Rita," the vixen's eyes shifted over towards the ferretess in her other hand. "Well, you're just a bitch and I don't like you,"

Glenn shouted in protest, struggling in the vixen's grip. Rita just whimpered.

"Now. What should I do with you two?" Ruby mused.
1212.title: Payback Time

choices: Snack
Panty stuffer
12121.content:
Be it an unexpected effect of the ray, or just the knowledge that she held two lives, two individuals who’d roused her ire on multiple occasions, literally in the palm of her hands, Ruby felt a rush of power and confidence surging through her. To hell with her job, the legal consequences of her actions, or for that matter, getting back to normal size which she’d certainly need the help of the very same coworkers she threatened.

She flashed the pair a toothy smile, Glenn and Rita all to aware that they were now mouse-sized in the paws of a fox. “I’m going to need my hands for a bit,” Ruby informed her captives, “So…I think I’ll tuck you two away until I get bored. Or hungry.”

On that note, the vixen’s hands plunged into the cleavage of her bikini, the former space of occupancy for the size ray, stuffing her squirming captives down between her breasts, whatever enjoyment to be found in this confinement overridden by fear and embarrassment. “You were always sneaking looks at my chest, Glenn, and Rita, I know you’ve always been jealous, you flat little thing.”

Letting her newfound playthings settle in, Ruby adjusted her top, squishing and pressing the pair together in the valley of her chest. Flicking her tail in satisfaction at putting her boss in his place, she surveyed the rest of the beach and her fleeing cowowkers.

“Don’t leave! The party’s just starting.” Ruby stomped after them, putting herself between the fleeing crowds and the safety of the parking lot. Reaching down to the sand dunes, the giantess ploughed and scooped, creating a risen barrier, effectively trapping her toys between her and the ocean.

The collection included not just her coworkers, but also random bathers caught up in the rush—random strangers Ruby would feel even less concern for than Rita or Glenn whom she wanted to show off for and cower more so than anything else. Depending on the vixen’s whims, the experience for her reluctant toys could be harmless or lethal.

Dropping to her knees, Ruby eyed her subjects playfully, coming to rest on an athletic, muscular, grey husky male wearing, of all things, a Speedo. Having wanted to draw attention to himself from women thanks to his $50 dollar a week gym membership, the dog now greatly regretted his decision as an eye larger than his head rested on him, a pair of pinching fingers reaching forward.

“Mmm, lots of meat on you,” Ruby grinned, seizing her prize, “You get to be first. And I’m in the mood for a—”
12121.title: She decides to embarrass them.

choices: ... dance for me,"
... choose someone else to replace you,"
121211.content:
Ruby grinned from ear to ear as she watched the husky's reaction to her declaration. He was helpless in her grip with no chance of escape, yet he still struggled and squirmed as if he had a prayer.

"You--you can't do that! Don't... don't..." the husky's shriek tailed off to a whimper.

"Don't what?" Ruby cackled. "Eat you?"

The husky started shaking violently, unable to muster a response.

"Well, see, the thing is, I am getting kinda hungry," the vixen responded gleefully, carefully watching his response. "But... I'm merciful on occasion. And maybe this is one of those instances, who knows,"

"Th-thank you!" the husky gulped, able to find his words for the first time.

"Oh, don't thank me yet. You aren't quite off the hook... or out of the hand, whatever you want to call it,"

"What do you want from me?"

"Well, let's see..." Ruby sighed dramatically. "I want you to...
121211.title: Snacktime?

choices: Spits out and spares her plaything
Swallows her treat/seals their fates
1212111.content:
"You've obviously put a lot of work into those glutes," Ruby teased her new playmate. "And that skimpy little thing between your legs means you rather like showing them off." She tapped the husky between the buttocks, spilling forward in the sand--or would have had her other hand not been there to catch him. "So, I'm thinking, why don't you give me a little show?"

"Ruby!" Glenn cried from within her chest, "Don't--whatever you're--the liability."

"Oh, hush, you," in response, the vixen pushed her boss down her top, the rest of his protests muffled beneath the fluff of her cleavage. "Always fussing about legal." She snorted, turning her attention back to the beach bully. "Now, start shaking it." The husky stared, slack-jawed at the vulpine goddess' processing her demand until Ruby added, "Of course, all that growing did work up an appetite."

That did the trick. The husky must have been planning to moonlight as a male stripper, she thought, watching his buff physique wriggle and gyrate: first nervously, then more fluidly as his own ego pushed its way above the fear--mostly, she thought. The wideness of his eyes and tremor to his dance suggested he was far from enjoying it--oh well, she certainly was.

"Not bad," Ruby said after a few minutes, seemingly satisfied with the show. "To show my appreciate, I'll give you a little kiss." She leaned forward, pecking the husky on the chest, pushing him back into her hand. He opened his mouth to thank or beg, but before he could, the fox opened her mouth and ran her tongue down his front, leaving him slick from head to toe, curling between his legs and drawing him closer to her dainty muzzle, as before the horrified onlookers, Ruby slurped the squirming husky into her mouth.

Inside the fox's mouth, the hapless furson wriggled and squirmed, inadvertently causing her to salivate around him as well as spreading his taste across her smooth tongue. Ruby blinked, surprised at the sensation--unexpected, but quite welcome. She could barely hold the mouthful of husky and saliva, threatening to reflexively swallow both.

All eyes were on the fox goddess now, her actions in the next second setting the tone for the "party" and their chances of survival. This was what it meant to be a goddess, Ruby thought, eyes closed in bliss, to have such utter power over lesser beings that all they could do was watch and pray--pray to her, as in full view of her captive audience, she
1212111.title: ... dance for me,"

choices: ... a consort,"
... to survey her domain,"
12121111.content:
Ruby let the crowd wait in suspenseful silence for a few moments before she opened her mouth, spitting her would-be victim onto the sand. The sodden husky scrambled away as quickly as he could, taking refuge in the back of the crowd. Ruby smirked, winking at him.

"Aw, I was just playing around," the massive vixen cooed innocently. "No need to get all panicky,"

"What the hell are you thinking?" Glenn piped up again from Ruby's cleavage. The vixen noted wryly that his tone was getting high and worried. "You have to cut this out!"

"Lighten up a little, 'coon," Ruby replied, patting his little head with her thumb. "I don't see what the big deal is here. Well, besides me, of course,"

"I'll give you a raise, more vacation time, whatever you want! Just please, please stop this!"

"I've already given myself a raise, Glenn," Ruby said.

The crowd let out a collective gasp, stepping backwards as the vixen slowly got to her feet. Drawing herself up to her full towering height, Ruby stood with feet shoulder-width apart, regarding the huddled group impassively.

"Here's the deal," the giantess boomed, adopting an authoritative tone. "I am your goddess now. You all exist to please me and see to my needs, wants, and desires. Now, I can see this going two ways. Keep me happy and we won't have a problem. I think you'll find I can be quite accommodating. But if I start to get displeased, well... I just might need to start breaking stuff. Sound good? Sounds good to me,"

Ruby grinned down at the crowd, hitching her hip to the side. She could definitely get used to this.

"But first things first. This goddess needs...
12121111.title: A Merciful Goddess

choices: ... get revenge on all of his coworkers.
... go on a giant-sized rampage.
... sell the device to a rival company.

(open choice)
13.content:
Intern Troubles

"What the fuck is this?" Glenn spat, slamming down the paper takeaway cup on Ike's desk.

"Er, coffee?" the red-and-gold scaled dragon took a wild guess.

"Shit terrible coffee," the raccoon corrected. "Get me a different one. Earm coffee, if possible. Venti americano, no room,"

"But I just got that one for you!" Ike pointed out. "I really need to finish this report for Ruby. I'll nuke it for you, if you like. Warm it up again,"

"If by 'nuke' you mean 'do your job and get a fucking new one', then absolutely," Glenn fumed. "What are we paying you to do here, anyway?"

"It's an unpaid internship," Ike reminded him for the umpteenth time.

"And this is why we don't pay you?" Glenn was already stalking away. "Go on. Fly to the cafe if it'll get you there faster,"

"Absolutely,"

Ike rolled his eyes as soon as he was sure the raccoon had left the room. Glenn loved that poor excuse for a joke, despite the fact that Ike, like most other dragons, had no wings. He wasn't exactly sure where that came from. Most dragons didn't burn down villages or kidnap princesses, either. Fucking racists.

Grumbling loudly, Ike pushed back from his desk and pulled on his coat. As he trudged down the hall, hands stuffed into pockets, Ruby poked her head around the door of her office.

"You have that report done yet?" the vixen asked.

"Sorry, no. I'll have it--it'll be--soon," Ike mumbled, blushing violently. Conversations of this sort rarely went well for Ike, partially because he hated disappointing his supervisor, but also because he had something of a crush on her. "I need to step out. Just for a moment,"

"Well, okay," Ruby said. "But we need that by the 14.30 meeting, you know,"

Shuffling away, Ike headed towards the exit of the research and development wing. There was no way in hell all of this abuse was worth the measly five research credits he was getting at his university. Total bullshit.

As he neared the double doors, Ike noticed that the door to storage was slightly ajar. Curious, the red-gold drake peered around the door. He'd never been allowed in there before, though he'd had to work on the administrative paperwork for much of it.

Double-checking to make sure the hallway was still vacant, Ike slipped into the room, closing the door behind him. His footsteps echoing off the steel-tiled floor, Ike wandered around the space, staring at the various strange objects held in cases.

A small silver gunlike device resting on a pedestal towards the back of the room caught Ike's eye. He strode towards it, a grin flicking across his face. Oh, he knew exactly what this was. Picking it up, Ike weighed it in his hand. This was perfect: for the first time since he'd started this internship, maybe there was a silver lining. Hurriedly, Ike stuffed the device into his coat pocket and rushed out the doors. Plans for what to do were already forming in his mind. Ike wanted to...
13.title: Intern Troubles

choices: ... to take you all for a bit of a swim,"
... for a snack,"
... for Ruby to go on a date with me,"
131.content:
"Where is that dragon?" Glenn asked, pacing back and fort at the front of the long oaken conference table. "I sent him out hours ago!"

"Oh, so you were the reason he left this morning?" Ruby asked, massaging her temples. "You're the man, really,"

"How was I to know he would be unable to find the cafe a half a block away?" the raccon threw his hands in the air.

"Well, there's no point in bitching about it now, guys," James, a mink sitting at the end of the table, grumbled. "Let's just get on with the meeting,"

"Well, we can't really do that without Ike's report, can we?" Ruby shot back.

"I'm sure we can't forge on without the fucking intern," James exclaimed sarcastically. "Let's try to--"

A violent tremor interrupted the mink's rant. Dust fell from the ceiling and several glasses of water fell over. Ruby shot to her feet, looking around in surprise.

"What was that?" she breathed.

"Just a bit of a tremor," Glenn shook his head. "Nothing too out of the ordinary,"

Ruby squeaked and dove under the table as another violent tremor shook the conference room. This wasn't the first time the vixen cursed herself inwardly for moving to such an earthquake-prone area. The power winked out, adding insult to injury.

"The generators will kick in shortly, don't worry," James said reassuringly, sensing Ruby's nerves.

"Where the hell has the Sun gone?" Glenn reathed.

Ruby peeked out from under the table as the safety lights flickered on, bathing the room in faint, pale light. Sure enough, she saw that the windows looking outside showed nothing but pitch black. A third tremor, more powerful than eiher of the others, sent the gathered individuals flying.

"I'm getting out of here," Ruby said. "Too many windows,"

The vixen beat it out of the conference room, stumbling down the dimly lit hallway for the security of her own office. Glenn followed on her heels, trying and failing to appear nonchalant. The pair sat on the floor in the office, bracing themselves against the walls whenever a tremor shook the room.

"Is this ever going to stop?" Ruby asked nervously.

"I'm sure it will soon. There'll be emergency responders coming to check on us soon, I'm sure. This isn't their first rodeo in the earthquake department," Glenn replied.

Ruby stood up as she heard a knock on the door. "Yes?"

James poked his head around the door, visibly nervous. "Er, you... uhh... just look at this,"

Glenn and Ruby followed after James as he rushed back toward the conference room. As they entered, Ruby let out an audible gasp.

Light was streaming once again through the windows, but the view had changed. Rather than a view of the building opposite, the gathered individals saw a single enormous eye peering back at them. It was deep amber with a slit pupil.

"Is that... is that Ike?" Ruby breathed.

James couldn't respond and Glenn, for perhaps the first time in his life, was at a loss for words. Deep chuckling rumbled through the building.

"Hello there. Sorry for the rough transport, but it's the first time I've shrunk a building," Ike's powerful voice resonated through the conference room. "But we're all safe and sound in my apartment now, no worries,"

"What... why...?" James couldn't find the proper words.

Ike chuckled again. "Why not? But I don't have time for your silly questions right now. I think it's time...
131.title: Boardroom Drama

choices: ... Ava was enlarged to gigantic proportions.
... Ava was shrunk to minuscule size.
... nothing noteworthy happened right away.
14.content:
"Excuse me, but are you Clark? I'm Ava Sharpe with the Times. The front desk told me to come here," the dovess said, gesturing to the press badge pinned to her blouse.

"Hmm? That's me," the short badger blinked uncertainly. "How can I help you?"

"The emails we sent? Is today actually not a good day for you?" Ava replied.

"Oh, yes! That's right. Sorry. Busy busy busy," the badger laughed nervously. "I made sure to clear my schedule this afternoon for the tour,"

The dovess smiled. "Great. Thanks again for being so open about this,"

Clark nodded, bustling around his office looking for the keys. Finding them, he gestured for Ava to follow him out of the room.

"I'm sure you left your camera and recording devices with the receptionist, right?" the badger said as they breezed down the hall towards the research wing. "Trade secrets and all that, you know,"

"Got nothing but the ol' melon," Ava grinned, tapping her temple.

"Well, then, all systems go," Clark smiled, holding open the heavy metal door of the research wing for Ava.

The first half hour or so of the tour wasn't nearly as exciting as Ava had been anticipating or hoping. She'd spent the prior weeks digging into Genex Biotechnologies. Something about the whole company had struck her as off. But she needed validation. She had to go to the source and see if she could find anything below the glossy surface.

So far, no luck. All they had to offer was a series of probably useful, if not slightly dull, gadgets for point of care hospital use. The company's worst offence seemed to be, if nothing else, the oblivious (albeit very well-meaning) Clark.

Ava knew she needed to pry deeper. But, as it became increasingly apparent, Clark wouldn't be of any use in that department. He was just too dense. Time to take matters into her own hands.

"Er, Clark? If you don't mind, do you have a drinking fountain anywhere?" the dovess said, touching her throat. "I'm parched,"

The badger's face brightened. "Of course! Right around the corner here,"

As Ava wet her whistle, Clark tapped his foot nervously. "If you don't mind, I think I'm gonna step into the men's really quick," he mumbled sheepishly. "Gotta... take care of business,"

"No worries," Ava smiled. "I'll just wait right here,"

Ava did not, in fact, wait right there. As soon as Clark was through the door, the dovess took off down the hallwaym trying every door.

The fifth door finally opened, and the reporter slipped through. On the other side was a large room that almost seemed as if it didn't belong in the building. The space was spare and industrial, with white-tiled floors and walls. The center of the room was depressed, with several concentric rings of black tile.

Baffled, Ava wandered around the space, trying to memorize as much detail as she could. What on earth was going on here? The dovess' eyes focused on a low metal partition on the far side of the black-ringed area. A small hole in its center emitted a slowly pulsing bluish light.

Ava walked towards the hole, stepping into the depressed area. The pulsing began to increase in frequency, accompnied by a dull whirring sound. Ava ground to a halt, staring at the hole. Too late, she realized that this couldn't be anything good.

"Oh, sh--" Ava said as a particle beam blasted out of the hole, striking her squarely in the chest. In the matter of moments...
14.title: Reportage

choices: ... you sorta destroyed the device while you were busy outgrowing the building,"
... the military is en route because they heard about the disturbance,"
... we haven't really figured out how to reverse things quite yet,"
141.content:
"What the hell just happened?" Ava mumbled, blinking blearily as the dust settled.

The past moments had been a cacophonous blur of sound and light, accompanied by a sharp pain that had spread throughout the dovess' body almost the instant she had been struck by the beam of light. But now, as her vision cleared, all be came far too apparent to--

"Holy shit!" Ava gaped, frozen in place as she stared at her surroundings.

The dovess stood at the site of the Genex Biotechnologies building, or more accurately, where the Genex Biotechnologies building had once been. The structure was now no more than rubble arrayed around the smart (though now slightly dusty) pumps of the dovess, who now rivalled the old building in size.

"What in the fuck is happening to me?" Ava squeaked, her voice raising in panic. Her heart was starting to race and she looked around for something, anything that could explain what was going on.

Glancing down at herself did nothing to calm the newly-minted giantess' nerves. Her black skirt and navy blue blazer were dotted with more rubble and, to her disbelief, a couple dozen of positively minuscule people clinging to the material. Well, that settles it, Ava thought feverishly. I'm having the weirdest dream of all time. Just need to wake myself up,

The dovess took a deep breath, trying to get her pulse back under control. Just need to calm down and you'll wake up, Ava convinced herself.

"Erm, Ava? Could we have a word?" came a tinny voice from somewhere on Ava's shoulder.

"Wha?" Ava blurted. "Is--is that you, Clark?" she asked, craning her neck to look at the tiny figure with a bullhorn standing on the end of her shoulder.

"Yeah," the badger replied. "Look, would you mind sitting down carefully? Some of these folks would probably like to get down,"

"Er, sure," the dovess said, gingerly sitting down cross-legged in the center of the ruined property. She rested her fingertips on her shoulder, allowing Clark to clamber on. "What is happening to me? Why is everything so small?"

"Well... it's not everything being small so much as you being really big," Clark mumbled, standing on the white-feathered surface of my palm. "There was something of a mishap with the device in the room you got into. It went off when it wasn't supposed to and... well... you see the end result,"

"But you can reverse it, right?" I asked, my voice hitching with worry.

141.title: Super-Sized Ava

Ava jumps up and down, waving her arms and making as much noise as she can.
Ava remembers the air horn she keeps in her purse for emergency situations.
142.content:
Ava massaged her temples with her fingertips, her eyes screwed shut. The blast from the strange beam had knocked the wind out of the dovess and given her one hell of a headache to boot. It felt as if she'd been wrung out like an old rag. As the sensations of nausea slowly subsided, Ava opened her eyes, blinking to clear her vision.

"...the hell?" she blurted aloud.

The room had certainly taken a turn for the odd. She stood presently in the middle of an expansive, blank space. Under her feet was a grid of large smooth white squares placed at even intervals, interspersed with the occasional black square made of the same slippery material. Craning her neck upward, the reporter tried to find a ceiling, but the space just seemed to go up and up, a white space that stretched forever.

Thoroughly confused, Ava selected a direction at random and began to walk. The beam must have knocked me out, she though, stuffing her hands in the pockets of her blazer. Bet they thought it would be hilarious to take me somewhere totally random. Well, they'll have another thing coming once I find them.

A faint tremor in the ground brought Ava to a startled halt. She looked around, looking for the source of the shaking. Then came another tremor, and another. They increased in intensity and frequency until Ava could barely keep on her feet.

Then she saw the source of the tremors.

"Oh, what the holy fucking shit," Ava gaped, any remaining color draining from her already white complexion.

The source of the shaking was a vixen. A positively colossal vixen. She was walking towards Ava, her buxom form dressed in a crisp white lab coat. Behind her was an equally enormous wolf dressed in similar attire. Ava probably didn't even reach the tops of their shoes.

"What the hell, Bruce?" the vixen snapped in thundering tones. "These tests aren't cheap! You can't just go blowing your wad with nothing in the testing area,"

"It was an honest mistake, Ruby!" the wolf protested in response. "I had a target set up earlier. I bet somebody moved it. Probably Ike. Fucking inept intern,"

"Be more careful next time, okay?" Ruby replied. "I don't want to have to go explaining myself to Glenn if he starts bitching about energy expenditures and all that shit,"

Holy shit. That beam must have shrunk me, Ava thought, numb with shock. How in the fuck is that even possible?

Looking around, Ava realized that had to be the impossible truth. She was indeed in the same room as before, just magnified to an impossibly huge scale. She knew she would have to get the attention of one or both of these newcomers if she would ever have a hope of fixing the situation. The minuscule dovess jumped into action...

1521.content:
Like most other days, Tuesday morning found Bryce at the gym a few blocks from his apartment. The chestnut-coated stallion was one of the regulars there and had the muscles to prove it. He stood in front of the long bank of full-length mirrors near the free weights rack, staring at his technique (but mostly himself) as he finished a set of bicep curls. Mopping the sweat from his brow, he set down the dumbbell and wandered over to the bench where he'd set his water bottle. Tipping it to his lips, he grunted in frustration as he found it more or less empty. He crossed over to the drinking fountain, refilling the bottle and guzzling the cool water greedily.

The stallion looked around the largely deserted space, running his fingers through his jet black mane. Suddenly, something didn't feel quite right. His stomach felt a bit queasy and his legs shaky. Bryce grunted as his head bumped into something. He glanced up, only to bash his muzzle into the ceiling. Confused, he looked down to see his water bottle, now clutched like a travel-sized shampoo bottle in his hand.

"The hell...?" he muttered to himself. Was he... growing?

The few other gymgoers in the area took notice as the enlarging stallion was forced to his knees by the growth spurt. A cat on the treadmills pulled out her earbuds, making a dash for the door as Bryce rocked forward onto hands and knees, expanding palms pressing against the floor. Within moments, the stallion filled the area, forcing aside weights and other exercise equipment. It soon became apparent: there was nowhere to go but out.

A clamor arose in the streets as a colossal stallion dressed in a white wife beater and black spandex shorts burst onto the scene, standing up clear through the roof of the gym. He stood as tall as the fifteen-story bank building next to the gym, looking around in bewilderment and confusion.

"Holy shit," Bryce muttered to himself, brows high in shock.

info.description: Genex Biotechnologies is a hot up-and-coming biotech firm. It's gotten recognition for being on the forefront of progress in the field, earning grudging respect from its competitors for the genius of its technologies and ruthless business strategy of its leadership. But what the rest of the tech world doesn't know is that Genex is developing a top-secret device capable of dramatically changing the size of objects. With this sort of tech in the wrong hands, anything is possible.
